intro: Hieracium ramiferum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium ramiferum is an herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes and is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
